com.metreeca.rest

Interface Body<V>

  • Type Parameters:
    V - the type of the structured message body managed by the body format
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DataBody, InputBody, JSONBody, MultipartBody, OutputBody, RDFBody, ReaderBody, TextBody, WriterBody

    public interface Body<V>
    Message body format.

    Manages the conversion between raw and structured message bodies.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static Failure Missing
      The default failure reporting missing message bodies.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default Result<V,Failure> get(Message<?> message)
      Retrieves a structured body from a message.

      Function<T,Result<R,Failure>>      		 map(Function<V,R> mapper)
      Maps this body format.
      default <T extends Message<T>>

      Configures a message to hold a structured body.

    • Field Detail

      • Missing

        static final Failure Missing
        The default failure reporting missing message bodies.

    • Method Detail

      • map

        default <T extends Message<T>,R> Function<T,Result<R,Failure>> map(Function<V,R> mapper)
        Maps this body format.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the target message for the body format generator
        R - the type of the value returned by mapper
        Parameters:
        mapper - the value mapping function; must return a non-null value
        Returns:
        a body format generator applying mapper to the values retrieved from a message by this body format
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if mapper is null

      • get

        default Result<V,Failure> get(Message<?> message)
        Retrieves a structured body from a message.

        Processing failure should be reported using the following HTTP status codes:

        • Response.UnsupportedMediaType for missing bodies;
        • Response.BadRequest for malformed bodies, unless a more specific status code is available.

        The default implementation returns a failure reporting the Response.UnsupportedMediaType status, unless explicitly overridden.

        Parameters:
        message - the message the structured body managed by this body format is to be retrieved from
        Returns:
        a value providing access to the structured body managed by this body format, if it was possible to derive one from message; an error providing access to the processing failure, otherwise
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if message is null

      • set

        default <T extends Message<T>> T set(T message)
        Configures a message to hold a structured body.

        The default implementation has no effects.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of message
        Parameters:
        message - the message to be configured to hold a structured body managed by this body format
        Returns:
        the configured message
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if message is null
